Package com.moleculepowered.api.util

Class Time

java.lang.Object
com.moleculepowered.api.util.Time
public final class Time extends Object
A utility class that provides a variety of methods related to Time, Dates, etc.
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
OMGitzFROST

  • Constructor Details

    • Time

      public Time()

  • Method Details

    • add

      @NotNull public static @NotNull Date add(@NotNull @NotNull Date start, @NotNull @NotNull String input)

      Adds a specified amount of time to the start date, please note that this method does require a specific format to be entered as its input, That format is as follows "[#][unit]", for example "2h".

      With that input, it will tell this method to add 2 hours to the provided date, please take a look at the table below for all available unit abbreviations that are accepted by this method

      Unit Abbreviation
      Millisecond [ms, milli, millisecond, milliseconds]
      Second [s, sec, second, seconds]
      Minute [m, min, minute, minutes]
      Hour [h, hr, hour, hours]
      Day [d, day, days]
      Week [wk, week, weeks]
      Month [mo, month, months]
      Year [y, year, years]
      Parameters:
      start - The date that will be modified
      input - The time that will be added to the start date
      Returns:
      The new date
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when an invalid input is entered

    • add

      @NotNull public static @NotNull Date add(@NotNull @NotNull String input)

      Adds a specified amount of time to today's date, please note that this method does require a specific format to be entered as its input, That format is as follows "[#][unit]", for example "2h".

      With that input, it will tell this method to add 2 hours to today's date, please take a look at the table below for all available unit abbreviations that are accepted by this method

      Unit Abbreviation
      Millisecond [ms, milli, millisecond, milliseconds]
      Second [s, sec, second, seconds]
      Minute [m, min, minute, minutes]
      Hour [h, hr, hour, hours]
      Day [d, day, days]
      Week [wk, week, weeks]
      Month [mo, month, months]
      Year [y, year, years]
      Parameters:
      input - The time that will be added to today's date
      Returns:
      The new date
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when an invalid input is entered

    • subtract

      @NotNull public static @NotNull Date subtract(@NotNull @NotNull Date start, @NotNull @NotNull String input)

      Subtracts a specified amount of time to the start date, please note that this method does require a specific format to be entered as its input, That format is as follows "[#][unit]", for example "2h".

      With that input, it will tell this method to subtracts 2 hours to the date, please take a look at the table below for all available unit abbreviations that are accepted by this method

      Unit Abbreviation
      Millisecond [ms, milli, millisecond, milliseconds]
      Second [s, sec, second, seconds]
      Minute [m, min, minute, minutes]
      Hour [h, hr, hour, hours]
      Day [d, day, days]
      Week [wk, week, weeks]
      Month [mo, month, months]
      Year [y, year, years]
      Parameters:
      start - The date that will be modified
      input - The time that will be subtracted from the start date
      Returns:
      A new date
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when an invalid input is entered

    • subtract

      @NotNull public static @NotNull Date subtract(@NotNull @NotNull String input)

      Subtracts a specified amount of time to the start date, please note that this method does require a specific format to be entered as its input, That format is as follows "[#][unit]", for example "2h".

      With that input, it will tell this method to subtract 2 hours to the date, please take a look at the table below for all available unit abbreviations that are accepted by this method

      Unit Abbreviation
      Millisecond [ms, milli, millisecond, milliseconds]
      Second [s, sec, second, seconds]
      Minute [m, min, minute, minutes]
      Hour [h, hr, hour, hours]
      Day [d, day, days]
      Week [wk, week, weeks]
      Month [mo, month, months]
      Year [y, year, years]
      Parameters:
      input - The time that will be subtracted to the start date
      Returns:
      A new date
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when an invalid input is entered

    • parseDate

      @NotNull public static @NotNull Date parseDate(@NotNull @NotNull String format, @NotNull @NotNull String input)
      Parses the input into a usable Date object. This method takes a format as its first parameter but note that this format must match the format provided as the input.
      Parameters:
      format - Format representation of the input
      input - Target date
      Returns:
      A date from a string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when this method fails to parse the input into a date

    • parseDate

      @NotNull public static @NotNull Date parseDate(@NotNull @NotNull String input)
      Parses the input into a usable Date object. Please note that the input must follow the following format "MM/dd/yyyy" or otherwise an error will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      input - Target date
      Returns:
      A date from a string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when this method fails to parse the input into a date

    • parseInterval

      public static long parseInterval(@NotNull @NotNull String input)

      Mainly designed for repeating tasks, this method takes an input and converts it into a usable value, used by schedulers and similar.

      Please take a look at the table below for examples of valid inputs.

      Unit Abbreviation
      Millisecond [ms, milli, millisecond, milliseconds]
      Second [s, sec, second, seconds]
      Minute [m, min, minute, minutes]
      Hour [h, hr, hour, hours]
      Day [d, day, days]
      Week [wk, week, weeks]
      Month [mo, month, months]
      Year [y, year, years]
      Parameters:
      input - Provided input
      Returns:
      A usable interval
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the input is not valid

    • isBeforeDate

      public boolean isBeforeDate(@NotNull @NotNull String target, @NotNull @NotNull String comparedTo)
      A method used to test whether a date is before a different date.
      Parameters:
      target - The date being tested.
      comparedTo - The date you will compare the target to.
      Returns:
      Whether the target date is before the compared date.

    • getTimeRemaining

      public static String getTimeRemaining(@NotNull @NotNull Date start, @NotNull @NotNull Date end)
      A method used to return the amount of time remaining until a specified date. if any of the values listed in the format below return 0, this method will remove it from the returned string

      String Format: year(s) day(s) hour(s) minute(s) second(s).
      Parameters:
      start - Starting date
      end - Target date
      Returns:
      Time until target date.
